results.title: Topical simvastatin promotes healing of Staphylococcus aureus-contaminated cutaneous wounds.
results.text_hl: As @SPECIES_1280 @@@Staphylococcus aureus@@@ is one of the most important microorganism responsible for @DISEASE_Wound_Infection @DISEASE_MESH:D014946 @@@wound infections@@@, the aims of this study were to characterise the anti-@<m>DISEASE_Pneumonia_Staphylococcal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011023 @@@staphylococcal@@@ activity of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and to evaluate the application of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ as a topical therapy for S. aureus-contaminated wounds.

citations.NLM: Wang CC, Yang PW, Yang SF, Hsieh KP, Tseng SP, Lin YC. Topical simvastatin promotes healing of Staphylococcus aureus-contaminated cutaneous wounds. Int Wound J. 2016 Dec;13(6):1150-1157. PMID: 25752328

results.title: Statin-induced immunomodulatory effects on human T cells in vivo.
results.text_hl: Thus, immunomodulatory effects of statins on @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ T cells are first demonstrated in vivo and are differentially induced by two different statins: @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ led to a major histocompatibility class II (MHC II) antigens down-regulation and may therefore be investigated for treatment of chronic transplant rejection; @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ inhibited superantigen-mediated T cell activation, which might explain reduced mortality of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-treated @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Pneumonia_Staphylococcal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011023 @@@staphylococcal bacteremia@@@.
